data.title: Verizon Bell Atlantic Corporation (BNTR)
data.meta_description: Return to Corporate History Home Page
data.text:
Return to Corporate History Home Page

1990 - 1993

Bell Atlantic had no changes during this period. Prior to 1990, Bell Atlantic Corporation was holding company for seven operating companies with one study area jurisdiction for each: The Chesapeake and Potomac Telephone (C&P) - District of Columbia (CDDC), C&P of Maryland (CMMD), C&P of Virginia (CVVA), C&P of West Virginia (CWWV), The Diamond State Telephone Company (DSDE), The Bell Telephone of Pennsylvania (PAPA), and New Jersey Bell Telephone Company (NJNJ).

1994

Bell Atlantic Corporation changed the names of its seven operating companies on 1/1/1994.

1995 - 1996

Bell Atlantic Corporation had no changes during this period.

1997 - 1999

Bell Atlantic Corporation (BATR) acquired NYNEX Corporation (NXTR) on 8/14/1997, which consisted of two operating companies: New York Telephone Company (NYNY) and New England Telephone and Telegraph Company (NETC).

2000

On 6/30/2000, Bell Atlantic Corporation (BNTR) and GTE Corporation (GTTC) merged into one company, Verizon Communications (VCTR). During this period, a new corporate structure was created. However, the merged entities remained separate filing companies for ARMIS data. The original operating companies under Bell Atlantic did not change; only the operating companies were given new names, as follows:

2001 - 2007

The Verizon Bell Atlantic Operating Companies had no changes during this period.

2008

Effective April 1, 2008, FairPoint Communications acquired three study areas from Verizon New England: Maine, New Hampshire, and Vermont.

COSA

Effect

NETC

Verizon New England, Inc. (Remaining Study Areas NEMA, NERI)

NEME

Study area sold to FairPoint Communications (FPME)

NENH

Study area sold to FairPoint Communications (FPNH)

NEVT

Study area sold to FairPoint Communications (FPVT)

2009

The Verizon Bell Atlantic Operating Companies had no changes during this period.
